hints.label: def-qsd-recall
hints.title: Quasi-Stationary Distribution (Recall)
hints.content:
14: :label: def-qsd-recall
15: 
16: A **quasi-stationary distribution** $\nu_{\text{QSD}}$ on the alive state space is a probability measure such that:
17: 
18: $$
19: P(S_{t+1} \in A \mid S_t \sim \nu_{\text{QSD}}, \text{not absorbed}) = \nu_{\text{QSD}}(A)
20: $$
21: 
22: **Meaning**: If the swarm is distributed according to $\nu_{\text{QSD}}$ and survives, it remains in $\nu_{\text{QSD}}$.
23: 
24: For the mean-field density $\mu_t(x, v)$, the QSD condition is:
25: 
26: $$
27: \partial_t \mu_{\text{QSD}} = 0
28: $$

hints.label: thm-convergence-qsd-recall
hints.title: Exponential Convergence to QSD (Recall)
hints.content:
38: :label: thm-convergence-qsd-recall
39: 
40: The Euclidean Gas converges exponentially to the unique QSD:
41: 
42: $$
43: \|\mu_t - \mu_{\text{QSD}}\|_{\text{TV}} \leq C_{\text{conv}} e^{-\kappa_{\text{QSD}} t}
44: $$
45: 
46: where $\kappa_{\text{QSD}} > 0$ is the convergence rate.

hints.label: prop-equipartition-qsd-recall
hints.title: Equipartition at QSD (Recall)
hints.content:
56: :label: prop-equipartition-qsd-recall
57: 
58: At the QSD, the velocity variance satisfies **equipartition**:
59: 
60: $$
61: V_{\text{Var},v}^{\text{QSD}} = \frac{d \sigma_{\max}^2}{2\gamma}
62: $$
63: 
64: where:
65: - $d$: Spatial dimension
66: - $\sigma_{\max}$: Noise amplitude
67: - $\gamma$: Friction coefficient
68: 
69: **Proof**: The drift inequality for $V_{\text{Var},v}$ (Theorem 3.2.1 in Chapter 4) gives:
70: 
71: $$
72: \mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\gamma (V_{\text{Var},v} - V_{\text{Var},v}^{\text{eq}}) \tau + O(\tau^2)
73: $$
74: 
75: At equilibrium ($\mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] = 0$):
76: 
77: $$
78: V_{\text{Var},v}^{\text{eq}} = \frac{d \sigma_{\max}^2}{2\gamma}
79: $$
